title: Sri Lanka stocks trading halted after 5.1-pct fall
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stock trading was halted after a sensitive index dropped 5.1-pct on Monday with index heavy stocks coming under selling pressure, brokers said.

“Please note that the market has been halted due to the S&P SL20 index dropping over 5% from the previous close, as set out in SEC Directive dated 30th April 2020,” the Colombo Stock Exchange said in a notice.
“Accordingly, the market will be halted and closed for the rest of the day.”
